text: Four ( 3 . 9 % ) pneumonia cases presented a ventricular septal defect . None had previous tuberculosis or underlying lung disease . Among cases with pulmonary crackles , 36 ( 35 . 3 % ) were unilateral and 66 ( 64 . 7 % ) were bilateral . Other signs or medical history of pneumonia cases included sickle - cell anaemia ( n = 1 ) , dehydration ( n = 1 ) , epilepsy ( n = 1 ) , goiter ( n = 1 ) , edema ( n = 1 ) , pallor ( n = 1 ) , and trisomy ( n = 3 ) .
